author: @Celeste-.-marie
text: I'm in my grad certificate data analytics program and a recruiter just reached out to me for a role! My first recruiter. I'm incredibly interested but seems a bit above my skill level. I am not sure whether to just go for it or be a little more realistic in what skills are required for the job. After all, you always hear that the job description and requirements are only a "wish list." Any thoughts on that? I don't want to embarrass myself for going for a role I'm not ready for yet. The specific job presented to me only stated "skills in..." not years of experience. They specifically want EHR experience, which I have in my healthcare provider background. I'm new to navigating this field so I just have no idea what to even expect and how on the job training they provide.

text: your tips on working with recruiters are spot-on, especially the message prompt ‚Äì short, sweet, and professionally crafted. The attention to detail like profile pictures and bios truly emphasizes the importance of first impressions. It's those little things that make a big difference!
